snippet: As the nature of technology is changing, the International Consumer Electronics Show is changing too. Fewer of the announcements of the most important products are made there. The show is still important to many retailers, though, who either place...
abstract: As the nature of technology is changing, the International Consumer Electronics Show is changing too. Fewer of the announcements of the most important products are made there. The show is still important to many retailers, though, who either place orders or just get a look at new merchandise. Coverage of the show is over on the Gadgetwise blog.
lead_paragraph: The International Consumer Electronics Show cannot be ignored, reports Nick Wingfield, one of The New York Times reporters at the annual technology extravaganza held in Las Vegas. But he writes that the changing nature of the technology industry is reflected in the fact that the most important developments are no longer coming from the the show.

headline.main: Daily Report: The Consumer Electronics Show
